document_title: Corneal ulcers: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content:
Doctors evaluate the ulcer using a slit lamp (an instrument that allows the doctor to examine the eye under high magnification). To see the ulcer clearly, your doctor may apply eye drops containing a dye called fluorescein. The fluorescein temporarily stains damaged areas of the cornea, allowing the doctor to see damaged areas of the cornea that otherwise would not be visible.
Modern machines and techniques help check eye problems for patients
In some situations, the doctor will scrape the surface of large ulcers to obtain a sample. The sample is then cultured to identify the bacteria, fungi, viruses or parasites causing the infection. Once the organism is identified, doctors will choose the best medication to treat it.
